InstructorProfile.title: InstructorProfile
InstructorProfile.description: Represents the professional profile of an instructor.

id.description: Unique identifier for the instructor profile.

userId.description: Reference to the User entity. (Relationship: User 1:1 InstructorProfile)

bio.description: A short biography of the instructor.

certifications.description: List of certifications held by the instructor.

profilePictureUrl.description: URL of the instructor's profile picture.

Class.title: Class
Class.description: Represents a class offered by an instructor.

schedule.description: Scheduling details for the class (e.g., days, times).

availability.description: Number of available slots in the class.

isActive.description: Indicates whether the class is currently active.

Booking.title: Booking
Booking.description: Represents a student's booking for a class.

bookingDate.description: Date and time when the booking was made.

attendanceStatus.description: Attendance status of the student for the class (e.g., Attended, Absent).

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: Represents a notification sent to an instructor or student.

userId.description: Reference to the User that the notification is for. (Relationship: User 1:N Notification)

type.description: Type of notification (e.g., New booking, Class reminder).

sentAt.description: Date and time when the notification was sent.

isRead.description: Indicates whether the notification has been read.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the application (either an instructor or a student).

role.description: The role of the user, e.g., 'instructor' or 'student'.

definition.description: Stores user information. Each user document is uniquely identified by its userId.
Stores the instructor profile information, linked 1:1 with the User entity. Accessible only to the user.

params.name: userId
params.description: Unique identifier for the user (also the instructor).

definition.description: Stores classes created by instructors.  Includes denormalized 'instructorId' for authorization independence.
Stores bookings for each class. Includes the 'studentId' for authorization independence.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability for the Plads Pro application. Instructor profiles are stored under `/users/{userId}/instructorProfile` to leverage path-based ownership, ensuring only the user can access their own profile. Classes are stored under `/instructors/{instructorId}/classes/{classId}`, allowing instructors to manage their classes, with the instructorId also stored in the Class document for authorization independence. Bookings are stored under `/classes/{classId}/bookings/{bookingId}` and contain the `studentId` to enable rules to verify user booking and attendance. Notifications are structured under `/users/{userId}/notifications/{notificationId}`, providing a clear path for delivering notifications to specific users.

**Authorization Independence:** The design emphasizes denormalization. For example, the `Class` entity includes `instructorId`, even though the path includes it as well, allowing security rules to validate instructor ownership without additional `get()` calls. The `Booking` document includes `studentId` and is located under `/classes/{classId}`, denormalizing the `classId` from the path so the security rules can validate the request.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):** The segregation of data into instructor-owned classes and user-owned notifications supports secure list operations. Listing classes under `/instructors/{instructorId}/classes` is secure because the instructor ID is part of the path. Similarly, listing notifications under `/users/{userId}/notifications` is secure because the user ID is part of the path. The structure avoids mixing data with different access needs within the same collection.
